oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pickard Family Performance P-17-B & P-18-B
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 6 of 7. Two recordings of the Pickard Family (performance group) from an unknown date, and December 8, of an unknown year, respectively. The first session is labeled P-17-B; The second session is labeled P-18-B. Sessions are recorded in Mexico.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pickard Family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Eighth of January -- (01:12) Obed Pickard, Ruthie Pickard, and Charlie Pickard talk about Obed's jew's harp playing -- (02:19) Old Rock of Ages Cleft for Me (Pickard Family) -- (04:46) Obed introduces a commercial announcement -- (05:05) Over the Waves [Instrumental] (Pickard Family) -- (05:44) Charlie and Ruthie appreciate Obed's playing -- (06:19) The Lightning Express (Charlie Pickard) -- (08:42) Obed outro statements -- (09:06) Pass Me Not Oh Gentle Savior (Pickard Family) -- (10:58) Way Down upon the Sewanee River (Jug Band) -- (11:24) Ruthie, Charlie, Obed and Bub talk about skating and respect for the jug -- (12:54) Home on the Range (Pickard Family) -- (15:22) The Pickard Family talk about the various performers of "Home on the Range" -- (15:53) [Unidentified piano duet] (Pickard Family) -- (16:19) Ruthie and Charlie introduce "It Seems I've Always Held Your Hand" (16:57) It Seems I've Always Held Your Hand (Pickard Family) -- -- (19:14) Obed says goodbye and introduces "In the Land Where We Never Grow Old" (19:33) In the Land Where We Never Grow Old (Pickard Family)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pickard Family (Musical Group);
